byline.contributor: Azam Ahmed and Paulina Villegas reported from Mexico City, and Jim Yardley from Rome. Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Rome.
byline.original: By AZAM AHMED, JIM YARDLEY and PAULINA VILLEGAS

abstract: Mexican government plans warm welcome for Pope Francis, despite historical tensions between state and church and risk pontiff will further expose darker corners of Mexican society; first Latin American pope will himself face high expectations to influence change in region acutely plagued by problems his papacy strives to address.
lead_paragraph: The government is hoping for a credibility boost from the pope’s visit, but his itinerary also poses a risk by highlighting some of the state’s most obvious failings.

headline.main: Francis’s Visit to Mexico Comes as Country Struggles With Many Ills
headline.print_headline: Pope Francis to Visit a Mexico Battling Many Ills

snippet: The government is hoping for a credibility boost from the pope’s visit, but his itinerary also poses a risk by highlighting some of the state’s most obvious failings.
